author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In the castle of coin and gold,
Quiet billy goat peers, bold.
His strength remains, though dollar ebbs,
Yet metals shine in spider's webs.

A rabbit, white against the green,
In last day's month, a sight unseen.
He leaps and falls, his journey hard,
Yet deep within, his strength is starred.

Crude is the oil, like snail's slow glide,
Strong gains this month in stride aside.
Yet, late at night, the owls do fret,
For has the trader overstretched his net?

feedItems.title: Metals Inch Higher Despite Demand Uncertainty
feedItems.description: Base metals and gold made solid gains as the dollar eased back, but with the greenback generally remaining strong, BMI said it saw little scope for a strong rise in prices in the coming months.

feedItems.title: Dollar Falls on Month-End Profit Taking; Data to Test Investor Sentiment
feedItems.description: The dollar fell on month-end profit taking and as Treasury yields retreated from high levels, but the currency’s “underlying strength” has not been reversed, with the DXY dollar index still trading around 106, UniCredit Research said.

feedItems.title: Crude Oil Tempers Gains Amid Strong Monthly Rise
feedItems.description: Crude oil prices inched higher in Europe, with the recent rally tempered late Thursday over worries that oil had become overbought, ING said.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Look hearth to China, thine bidding display,
Loosed are the data furrows, to 'liven trade,
Like blessed wine, 'cross borders it may stray,
And in its flow, more golden coins be made.

In the Far East, Nikkei dost end so plain,
Carts and finance falter, yet chips don't wane,
Like a tavern feast, where some dish gives pain,
Yet lusty pudding brings joy in its gain.

O, Merry England! Thy growth doth not tire,
Thy gold swells, resisting inflation's fire,
Like hearty ale, despite the cost, aspire,
To quench the thirst, which gloomy days require.

feedItems.title: China Proposes Easing of Cross-Border Data Controls
feedItems.description: The country’s cyberspace regulator has proposed the easing of cross-border data-security controls in a bid to boost business activities within the country.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Ends Flat as Auto, Financial Stocks Weigh
feedItems.description: The Nikkei Stock Average closed flat at 31857.62 as losses in auto and financial stocks offset gains in chip stocks.

feedItems.title: U.K. Economic Growth Revised Higher
feedItems.description: U.K. GDP expanded 0.2% in the second quarter, matching preliminary estimates, but growth in the first three months of the year was revised up, indicating the economy could be withstanding some of the pressures from high inflation.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In Poland’s hall, a maelstrom brews in sight,
Oscar-chosen weaver of silver tales,
For in her craft, their sacred wyrd she veils,
A sea of refuge, stirring wrathful might.

‘Cross the dragon-veined mountain, in the East,
A teacher falls, kindling a fierce debate,
Where the wolf cubs roam and the learned wait,
For shield of right to quell the monstrous beast.

In southern lands, where the gold rooster cries,
The Bank, a bulwark stout against the tide,
Holds firm its rate, with hawk's grim gaze applied,
Reflecting Mjolnir's glint in the sky's guise.

feedItems.title: Poland's Culture Wars Snare Oscar-Nominated Director Agnieszka Holland
feedItems.description: As parliamentary elections in mid-October near, government leaders say a movie about a recent refugee crisis tarnishes the country.

feedItems.title: Suicide Ignites Debate Over Protecting Teachers
feedItems.description: In South Korea, the death of a first-grade teacher in an elite school district has fueled protests over student protections put in place over the past decade.

feedItems.title: Reserve Bank of Australia Set to Extend Rate Pause But Retain Hawkish Hue
feedItems.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia is widely expected to leave its official cash rate on hold for a fourth month on Tuesday.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Upon the morrow's break, McCarthy thus had won,
His trials of coin in vaults deep, his rallying cry begun.
Within those hallowed hewn oak halls, unity did they affirm,
Against the Democrats' advance, a looming storm to spurn.

Though worn and prone to fail, the BM-21,
Desireth Ukraine more, 'gainst the setting of the sun.
From Soviet age it hails, imprecise yet stout of heart,
As they yearn for stalwart shields, 'gainst a world that's torn apart.

Evan Gershkovich, seized in land of frosts profound,
Upon such charge as espionage, in prison depths he's bound;
We cry out for his freedom, vowing our words speak truth,
For in his work’s reflective pool, shines the glow of veracious sleuth.

feedItems.title: Kevin McCarthy Wins Three, Loses One in Late-Night Spending Votes
feedItems.description: House Republicans largely succeeded in passing a series of annual spending bills, trying to show that the conference can stay united on legislation headed into any negotiations with Democrats to avert a shutdown.

feedItems.title: The BM-21 Is Obsolete and Prone to Breakdown, but Ukraine Wants More
feedItems.description: The BM-21 rocket launcher—like at least two-thirds of Ukraine’s arsenal—is from the Soviet era. WSJ explains how it works and why Ukraine is trying to get more, despite it being outdated and imprecise.

feedItems.title: EVAN GERSHKOVICH | DETAINED FOR 6 MONTHS
feedItems.description: Our colleague Evan was detained six months ago while reporting in Russia. He has been held in Moscow on an espionage charge that the Journal and the U.S. government vehemently deny.
